availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Garrison (Mason County, Kentucky, private 16th KY Vol Inf Reg)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, soldier. Virginia native. Son of Mary Garrison. Married to Tabitha E. Ramsay Garrison. Father of James Garrison. Resident of Mason County in 1850. Resident of Mason County in 1861. Served in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as a private from December 19, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 117A-B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 3, p. 427A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Boyd County Marriages, 1901-1905, Film #002116493, p. 479, p. 457 of 1217 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 937.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Roll 169, Kentucky, Application #344.782, Certificate #257.881.
KYR-0001-020-1574.
